clue: Of all sets I am definitely unique.
I am a subset of every set.
My cardinal number is zero and I am the identity for union of sets.
Remember empty barrels make the most noise. Who am I?
So far as diagrams are concerned, I am quite famous.
I am used to solve problems.
I am used to represent sets, elements and subsets. Who am I?
We are generally a pair of sets.
If we were human, we will never see eye to eye.
Put simply we have nothing in common.
Our intersection is always empty.
Who are we?
I am a binary operation.
I am in a way a meeting of minds.
I combine two sets and normally produce a smaller set.
I am where two curves meet.
I am a collection of common elements of two or more sets.
Who am I?
I am an operation on a non-empty set.
I involve two objects at a time.
Examples of me are union and intersection of sets.
I may be commutative or even associative.
I may have an identity on the set of operations.
Who am I?
I am a relation which is true for all values of the variable.
I am also a means of identification.
I am associated with binary operations.
For union of sets, I am an empty barrel which makes the most noise.
For intersection of sets, I am the whole universe.
For addition of real numbers, I am nothing to write home about.
I am the stuff Arithmetic is made of.
I am simply an operation or to be precise a type of operation.
I combine two terms to produce a third term.
Examples of me are the arithmetic operations of addition and subtraction.
Others are multiplication and division.
Remember I combine two terms at a time.
